conclusion: The number of turns of a circular coil is N=200, the area of the coil is S=1m^2, the resistance of the coil is r=10Ω, and the coil is connected to an external resistor with a resistance of R=50Ω. The coil is placed in a uniform magnetic field perpendicular to the plane of the coil and directed inward. The variation of the magnetic induction over time is shown in Figure B.

The image shows a circular coil with N = 200 turns, area S = 1 m^2, and resistance r = 10 Ω. The coil is connected in series with an external resistor R = 50 Ω. The coil is placed in a uniform magnetic field, and the variation of the magnetic induction over time is shown in Figure B.
The magnetic induction B varies over time as shown in Figure B. At t = 4 s, B changes from 0.2 T to 0.4 T.

premise: The magnetic induction B changes from 0.2 T to 0.4 T.
conclusion: The change in magnetic induction ΔB is 0.4 T - 0.2 T = 0.2 T.
The induced EMF ΔE is given by N × S × ΔB = 200 × 1 × 0.2 = 40 V.
The total resistance R_total in the circuit is r + R = 10 Ω + 50 Ω = 60 Ω.
The maximum power P consumed by the resistor R is calculated using the power formula: P = (ΔE)^2 / R_total = (40)^2 / 60 = 1600 / 60 = 26.67 W.

premise: The maximum power consumed by the resistor R is 26.67 W.
conclusion: The maximum power consumed by R is 26.67 W.
